problem.markdown: Q1. In plane table survey the method used for locating the plane table stations, is ( ) Traversing ( ) Resection ( ) Radiation ( ) Intersection (x) (A) or (B) above Q2. The process of putting the plane table into some fixed position so that a line representing a certain direction on the plane is parallel to that direction in the field is known as (x) Orientation ( ) Resection ( ) Intersection ( ) Levelling ( ) Centring Q3. The process of determining the plotted position of the station occupied by the plane table by means of the sights taken towards the known points, locations of which have been plotted is known as (x) Resection ( ) Radiation ( ) Intersection ( ) Traversing ( ) None of the above Q4. The two points and three pint problems are method of ( ) Orientation ( ) Resection ( ) Traversing (x) (A) and (B) above ( ) (B) and (C) above Q5. The method used to orient plane table at C with reference to two inaccessible points A and B is ( ) Radiation method ( ) Intersection method ( ) Traversing method (x) Two point problem ( ) Three point problem Q6. The accuracy of fix obtained by solving a two point problem is ( ) Good ( ) Fairly accurate (x) Not reliable ( ) Bad ( ) Unique Q7. The 'two point problem' is encountered in ( ) Chain surveying ( ) Theodolite surveying ( ) Compass surveying (x) Plane table surveying Q8. In case the plane table is not correctly oriented, the resectors will ( ) meet at a point ( ) be divergent (x) form a triangle of error ( ) None of the above Q9. The first, second and third temporary adjustments to be made in plane table surveying are respectively (x) levelling, centering, orientation ( ) centering, levelling, orientation ( ) orientation, centering, levelling ( ) orientation, levelling, centering Q10. Which method is preferred for solving three point problem? ( ) Bessel's method ( ) Lehman's method (x) Tracing paper method ( ) Any of the above
